tagrelator

Class PMI

  • java.lang.Object
    • tagrelator.PMI

  • public class PMI
extends java.lang.Object
    provides the computation of PMI values.
    a method for computing PMI values for a single Searchterm
    a method for computing PMI values for all Searchterms all at once

    following the Equation for PMI in the paper
    "Second Order Co-occurrence PMI for Determining the Semantic Similarity of Words" from

    Author:
    Aminul Islam, Diana Inkpen
    at time of programming available at http://hnk.ffzg.hr/bibl/lrec2006/pdf/242_pdf.pdf

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PMI()

      computes the PMI values for one Searchterm and its context words
      void selftest(java.lang.String fileName)

    • Method Detail

      • pmiSingle

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> pmiSingle(java.lang.String sTerm,
                                                             java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> contextFreqs,
                                                             java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordFreqs,
                                                             java.lang.Integer corpusSize)
        computes the PMI values for one Searchterm and its context words
        Parameters:
        sTerm - the searchterm
        contextFreqs - joint frequencies of the searchterm and context words,\n be sure to the the right contextFreq for a sTerm in there
        wordFreqs - should contain the idependent word frequencies of all word in the corpus
        Returns:
        a TreeMap sorted in ascending oder by PMI values

      • selftest

        public void selftest(java.lang.String fileName)
        to validate the correctness of the PMI computation
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of a plaintext file containing a comma separated list which is structured as follows
        the first line of the file should be size in words of the corpus from which the data stems
        following lines
        searchterm, idependent frequency of searchterm, context word, idependent frequency of context word, joint frequency, pmi value
        such data can be looked up on http://corpus.byu.edu/bnc/
